Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2014 10:38AM FranfromFL wrote: I didn't have reconstruction and I am not planning to do that.  I have tried Extra Strength Tylonol and Alieve at the recommended frequency and they don't seem to help much.  I did have to have my drainage tube removed too soon because it was leaking and not working.  I may have some liquid build up going on although I am not sure how I would know that.  If that happens they said they would have to remove it with a needle.  I don't have a fever or any redness so I don't think it is infected.     I looked up post mastectomy pain and, unfortunately, found a page that said a sizable percentage of women who undergo mastectomies continue to suffer bothersome pain from the surgery for at least 10 years.  Yikes!!!  I wish I had not found that bit of info! Thanks, ladies.  I guess I learned that there is no "normal".
Posts.Title: Post Surgical Pain FranfromFL Ariom

Posts.Content: FranfromFL wrote: Eleven years ago, I had a mastectomy on my right breast.  I had pain for a few days and a little discomfort but not for long.  On 7/1/14, I had a mastectomy on my left breast.  The doctor prescribed a pain med when I left the hospital but it made me ill so I am not taking it.  It is now 11 days later and I am still having quite a bit of pain.  This time around the pain seems way worse and for a lot longer.  I am trying to find out what is "normal." If you have had a mastectomy, can you tell me if you were in a lot of pain and for how long?  If this isn't better by Monday, I am calling the surgeon.  This just doesn't seem right to me. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Post Surgical Pain FranfromFL Ariom
